1:
Call out now; is there anyone who will answer you?\q To which of the holy ones will you turn?
\q
2:
For anger kills the foolish man;\q jealousy kills the silly one.
\q
3:
I have seen a foolish person taking root,\q but suddenly I cursed his home.


\q
4:
His children are far from safety;\q they are crushed in the city gate.
\q There is no one to rescue them.
\q
5:
The hungry eat up their harvest;\q they even take it from among the thorns.
\q The thirsty pant for their wealth.


\q
6:
For difficulties do not come out from the soil;\q neither does trouble sprout from the ground.
\q
7:
Instead, mankind is born for trouble,\q just as sparks fly upward.


\q
8:
But as for me, I would turn to God himself;\q to him I would commit my causeâ€”
\q
9:
he who does great and unsearchable things,\q marvelous things without number.
\q
10:
He gives rain on the earth,\q and sends water on the fields.


\q
11:
He does this in order to set up on high those who are low;\q to raise to safety those who mourn.
\q
12:
He breaks the plans of the crafty people,\q so that their hands cannot achieve success.
\q
13:
He traps wise people in their own crafty actions;\q the plans of twisted people are hurried to their end.


\q
14:
They encounter darkness in the daytime,\q and grope at noonday as if it were night.
\q
15:
But he saves the poor person from the sword in their mouths\q and the needy person from the hand of mighty people.
\q
16:
So the poor person has hope,\q and injustice shuts her own mouth.


\q
17:
See, blessed is the man whom God corrects;\q therefore, do not despise the chastening of the Almighty.
\q
18:
For he wounds and then binds up;\q he wounds and then his hands heal.
\q
19:
He will rescue you out of six troubles;\q indeed, in seven troubles, no evil will touch you.


\q
20:
In famine he will ransom you from death,\q and in war from the hands of the sword.
\q
21:
You will be hidden from the scourge of the tongue;\q and you will not be afraid of destruction when it comes.
\q
22:
You will laugh at destruction and famine,\q and you will not be afraid of beasts of the earth.


\q
23:
For you will have a covenant with the stones in your field,\q and the beasts of the field will be at peace with you.
\q
24:
You will know that your tent is in safety;\q you will visit your sheepfold and you will not miss anything.
\q
25:
You will also know that your seed will be great,\q that your offspring will be like the grass on the ground.


\q
26:
You will come to your grave at a full age,\q like a stack of grain sheaves that goes up at its time.
\q
27: See, we have examined this matter; it is like this;\q listen to it, and know it for yourself."
